newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PHILIPPINE STOCKS - factors to watch - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PHILIPPINE STOCKS - factors to watch - April 1.

text.p: Following are views on the direction of Philippine stocks on Tuesday and main factors likely to affect trading.

* Shares are expected to trade in a narrow range on Tuesday with investors remaining cautious as a result of Dow Jones' sharp 157-point overnight drop, Anscor Hagedorn Securities Inc research head Noel Reyes says.
* Value turnover is expected to improve, reaching a peak on Thursday with the listing of Equitable Bank, says Sun Hung Kai Securities (Phil) Inc in its daily market outlook.
* Dearth of market moving news in the domestic arena will keep the market looking at Wall Street for direction, says Abacus Securities research manager Erwin Tan.
* The Dow Jones fell 157.11 points on Monday or 2.33 percent to 6,583.48. Philippine Long Distance Telephone's American Depositary Receipt was unchanged at $59-7/8.
* On Monday, the Philippine Stock Exchange composite index settled a shade down by 0.16 points to 3,222.98.
* Euro-med Laboratories Phil Inc said it will offer to the public 401 million shares to raise 1.235 billion pesos to 1.764 billion pesos.
* MUSIC Semiconductors Corp said it is pushing through with plans to list the company's shares in the U.S. on the NASDAQ stock exchange.
* Selecta Dairy Products Inc said it has firmed up an agreement with American giant Hershey's Food Corp to exclusively distribute Hershey's confectionery products in the Philippines.
* Inquirer and Malaya says Globe Telecom will remain unprofitable until 1999.
* Newspaper BusinessWorld says Central Bank expects inflation rate for March to remain very close to the 4.4 percent registered in February.
* The benchmark 91-day Treasury bill rate slipped to an average of 9.498 percent at the regular weekly auction from 9.724 percent last week, the Bureau of Treasury said.
* The peso closed higher at 26.363 to the dollar vs 26.364
* The Philippine interbank call loan average was unchanged at 9.9375 percent.
